page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY HINTON
page.content: {INTRODUCTION}- The village of Hinton on Green was bought by William Laslett in 1882 to help the poor and needy people.He was the M.P. for Worcestershire.This policy was not to sell any of the houses or land. But in the early 1970's he sold land to the Parish Council to provide council houses and O.A.P. bungalows who later sold land to private buyers. The corn mill was sold to the tennant as he would not improve the property unless he owned it. It is now a home. { {PRE-SECOND WORLD WAR}-Our survey revealed 10 houses built before 1940, 6 detached,3 semi and one terrace. 6 out of ten are rented and 4 are owned. 4 houses construed of brich the reminder of stone both Welsh and local.7 roofs were made of tile and three of slates.
